{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "Welcome to 95 Slide, your premier destination for exceptional hospitality, covienie hotel stays, and unforgettable dining experiences. With a passion for delivering outstanding service and comfort, we strive to exceed your expectations in every interaction. Whether you&#39;re traveling for business or leisure, our hotel offers the perfect blend of relaxation and convenience, while our restaurant serves up delicious cuisine in a warm and inviting atmosphere.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Dei Dei, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Attends to customers effectively, has great communication skills, good record keeping and willing to learn.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an NCE, OND, SSCE / GCE / NECO qualification with 1 - 2 years work experience.


Benefits


	Salary: N40,000 - N50,000 monthly.
	Free accomodation given.
	Competitive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;giftmoses95@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "95 Slide"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185293"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 30000,
      "maxValue": 75000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Receptionist Job at 95 Slide




        
    

        
        Welcome to 95 Slide, your premier destination for exceptional hospitality, covienie hotel stays, and unforgettable dining experiences. With a passion for delivering outstanding service and comfort, we strive to exceed your expectations in every interaction. Whether you're traveling for business or leisure, our hotel offers the perfect blend of relaxation and convenience, while our restaurant serves up delicious cuisine in a warm and inviting atmosphere.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Dei Dei, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

            
    




	Attends to customers effectively, has great communication skills, good record keeping and willing to learn.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an NCE, OND, SSCE / GCE / NECO qualification with 1 - 2 years work experience.


Benefits


	Salary: N40,000 - N50,000 monthly.
	Free accomodation given.
	Competitive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: giftmoses95@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Admin Officer",
  "description": "African Foundries Limited (AFL) was established to support the accelerating growth in Nigeria by making the country self-reliant for steel rebars and eliminating its dependence on imported rebars. AFL is set up to reach a 0.5 million-ton per year capacity for high strength rebars and allied products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogijo, Ogun

Job Summary


	We&#39;re seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Admin Officer to provide administrative support to our team.
	As an Admin Officer, you&#39;ll be responsible for managing day-to-day administrative tasks, ensuring the smooth operation of the office, and providing excellent support to colleagues.


Key Responsibilities


	Administrative Support: Provide administrative support to the team, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and greeting visitors.
	Document Management: Manage and maintain accurate and up-to-date records, files, and documents.
	Scheduling: Coordinate meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for colleagues.
	Communication: Handle incoming and outgoing mail, emails, and faxes.
	Office Management: Maintain office supplies, equipment, and facilities.
	Data Entry: Perform data entry tasks, including updating databases and spreadsheets Microsoft Excel is mandatory
	Reporting: Prepare and distribute reports, as required.


Requirements


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent required; degree in business administration or related field preferred.
	Experience: Previous administrative experience, preferably in an office setting.
	Skills: Excellent communication, organizational, and time management skills.
	Software: Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.


Desirable Skills:


	Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
	Problem-Solving: Ability to solve problems and think critically.
	Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues.
	Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Folajimi.omolara@africanfoundries.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "African Foundries Limited (AFL)"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Ogun",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185292"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    }
  }
}



Admin Officer Job at African Foundries Limited (AFL)




        
    

        
        African Foundries Limited (AFL) was established to support the accelerating growth in Nigeria by making the country self-reliant for steel rebars and eliminating its dependence on imported rebars. AFL is set up to reach a 0.5 million-ton per year capacity for high strength rebars and allied products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer

Job Location: Ogijo, Ogun

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We're seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Admin Officer to provide administrative support to our team.
	As an Admin Officer, you'll be responsible for managing day-to-day administrative tasks, ensuring the smooth operation of the office, and providing excellent support to colleagues.


Key Responsibilities


	Administrative Support: Provide administrative support to the team, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and greeting visitors.
	Document Management: Manage and maintain accurate and up-to-date records, files, and documents.
	Scheduling: Coordinate meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for colleagues.
	Communication: Handle incoming and outgoing mail, emails, and faxes.
	Office Management: Maintain office supplies, equipment, and facilities.
	Data Entry: Perform data entry tasks, including updating databases and spreadsheets Microsoft Excel is mandatory
	Reporting: Prepare and distribute reports, as required.


Requirements


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent required; degree in business administration or related field preferred.
	Experience: Previous administrative experience, preferably in an office setting.
	Skills: Excellent communication, organizational, and time management skills.
	Software: Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.


Desirable Skills:


	Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
	Problem-Solving: Ability to solve problems and think critically.
	Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues.
	Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Folajimi.omolara@africanfoundries.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Assistant",
  "description": "Life at Best Development Initiative (LABDI) is a team of change-makers who believe that every helping hand can create a better future for survivors of wars. We started extending help to vulnerable children and women who were affected by the insurgency which began in Borno state, Nigeria, in 2009. This moment intensified when we found that there were many such vulnerable children, women, and households who needed help with food, shelter, and education. Our team expanded and we spread out into different parts of the BAY states to make sure we cover all possible areas and help as many children, women, and households as possible. We support children, families, and communities affected by insurgencies and natural disasters.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Maiduguri, Borno
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Areas of Accountability
Procurement and Supply Chain Support:


	Assist the Procurement Officer in executing procurement activities in full compliance with LABDI&rsquo;s procurement policies, protocols, and donor regulations.
	Gather quotations and specifications from vendors and suppliers, completing all relevant documentation (including PRs, RFQs, CBAs, POs, etc.).
	Support staff in preparing clear and accurate procurement documents, including Purchase Requests (PRs).
	Communicate professionally with suppliers to obtain quotes, clarify specifications, and ensure timely delivery of quality goods and services.
	Review supplier invoices for accuracy and completeness, and assist in submitting payment requests with all necessary supporting documents to the Procurement Officer.
	Monitor the payment process to ensure timely transactions and maintain good supplier relations.
	Provide regular procurement status updates to relevant program teams and supply chain stakeholders.
	Participate in supplier evaluations and procurement committee meetings as needed.
	Ensure procured items are in line with programmatic specifications and meet standards for quality, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
	Adapt to shifting program priorities by reordering tasks logically and efficiently, in coordination with the Procurement Officer.
	Help maintain and regularly update procurement tracking tools, including the Procurement Tracker and supplier database.
	Effectively communicate procurement-related changes (e.g., supplier contact updates, changes in product specs, payment terms, delivery schedules) with colleagues and stakeholders.
	Support the Procurement Officer in evaluating, renewing, modifying, or establishing Framework Agreements (FWAs).
	Contribute to the preparation of procurement status and management information reports as required.
	Work closely with other procurement/supply chain team members and give necessary support when needed.
	Ensure that at all times LABDI procurement policy and procedures are implemented and adhered to and are within compliance to donor regulations.
	Responsible for ensuring Supplier Enablement activities are carried out so that as many suppliers as possible transact with LABDI
	Other duties assigned by the Supervisor (Procurement Officer) as and when required.


Additional Job Responsibilities:


	The duties and responsibilities as set out above are not exhaustive and the role holder may be required to carry out additional duties within reasonableness of their level of skills and experience.


Skills and Experience
Administrative &amp; General Skills:


	Level of Education &ndash; Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics or Business Administration or Economics.
	Professional certification in Procurement an added advantage.
	Communication &amp; Interpersonal Skill Level &ndash; Excellent.
	Language Requirements &ndash; English &ndash; Excellent.
	Level of IT literacy Required &ndash; (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Email system, Internet browsing) excellent.


Experience Expectations:


	Minimum of 2 years of prior work experience in a similar role in an NGO or private commercial sector.
	Practical experience in use of a reputable Procurement Management Software or ERP system.
	Experience of solving complex issues through analysis, definition of a clear way forward and ensuring buy-in.
	Great interpersonal and communication skills including negotiation and relationship building.
	High level of integrity/confidentiality and ability to work as part of a professional team.
	Highly developed cultural awareness and ability to work well in an international environment with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.
	High level of computer literacy. Especially excellent MS Excel/Word skills.
	Good oral and written communication skills; Fluency in spoken and written English.
	Commitment to LABDI&rsquo;s values


Skills and Behaviours (our Values in Practice):
Accountability:


	Accuracy and timeliness in all areas of responsibility.
	High level of accuracy in work, and ability to analyse complex sets of relationships and situations.
	Holds self and others accountable


Ambition:


	Creating best-in-class function.
	Future-orientated, thinks pro-actively


Collaboration:


	Working effectively with stakeholders to achieve common goals.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Builds and maintains effective relationships, with their team, colleagues, members and external partners approachable, good listener, easy to talk to


Creativity:


	Designing more effective admin systems.
	Willing to take disciplined risks


Integrity:


	Honest, encourages openness and transparency, demonstrates highest levels of integrity.


Note


	Qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply.
	LABDI has zero tolerance to sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA), any act of child abuse including sexual exploitation and sexual abuse constitute acts of serious misconduct and are therefore grounds for LABDI plenary measures, including summary dismissal.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-06",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Life at Best Development Initiative (LABDI)"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Borno",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185290"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Procurement Assistant Job at Life at Best Development Initiative (LABDI)




        
    

        
        Life at Best Development Initiative (LABDI) is a team of change-makers who believe that every helping hand can create a better future for survivors of wars. We started extending help to vulnerable children and women who were affected by the insurgency which began in Borno state, Nigeria, in 2009. This moment intensified when we found that there were many such vulnerable children, women, and households who needed help with food, shelter, and education. Our team expanded and we spread out into different parts of the BAY states to make sure we cover all possible areas and help as many children, women, and households as possible. We support children, families, and communities affected by insurgencies and natural disasters.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Assistant
Job Location: Maiduguri, Borno
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Areas of Accountability
Procurement and Supply Chain Support:


	Assist the Procurement Officer in executing procurement activities in full compliance with LABDI’s procurement policies, protocols, and donor regulations.
	Gather quotations and specifications from vendors and suppliers, completing all relevant documentation (including PRs, RFQs, CBAs, POs, etc.).
	Support staff in preparing clear and accurate procurement documents, including Purchase Requests (PRs).
	Communicate professionally with suppliers to obtain quotes, clarify specifications, and ensure timely delivery of quality goods and services.
	Review supplier invoices for accuracy and completeness, and assist in submitting payment requests with all necessary supporting documents to the Procurement Officer.
	Monitor the payment process to ensure timely transactions and maintain good supplier relations.
	Provide regular procurement status updates to relevant program teams and supply chain stakeholders.
	Participate in supplier evaluations and procurement committee meetings as needed.
	Ensure procured items are in line with programmatic specifications and meet standards for quality, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
	Adapt to shifting program priorities by reordering tasks logically and efficiently, in coordination with the Procurement Officer.
	Help maintain and regularly update procurement tracking tools, including the Procurement Tracker and supplier database.
	Effectively communicate procurement-related changes (e.g., supplier contact updates, changes in product specs, payment terms, delivery schedules) with colleagues and stakeholders.
	Support the Procurement Officer in evaluating, renewing, modifying, or establishing Framework Agreements (FWAs).
	Contribute to the preparation of procurement status and management information reports as required.
	Work closely with other procurement/supply chain team members and give necessary support when needed.
	Ensure that at all times LABDI procurement policy and procedures are implemented and adhered to and are within compliance to donor regulations.
	Responsible for ensuring Supplier Enablement activities are carried out so that as many suppliers as possible transact with LABDI
	Other duties assigned by the Supervisor (Procurement Officer) as and when required.


Additional Job Responsibilities:


	The duties and responsibilities as set out above are not exhaustive and the role holder may be required to carry out additional duties within reasonableness of their level of skills and experience.


Skills and Experience
Administrative & General Skills:


	Level of Education – Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics or Business Administration or Economics.
	Professional certification in Procurement an added advantage.
	Communication & Interpersonal Skill Level – Excellent.
	Language Requirements – English – Excellent.
	Level of IT literacy Required – (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Email system, Internet browsing) excellent.


Experience Expectations:


	Minimum of 2 years of prior work experience in a similar role in an NGO or private commercial sector.
	Practical experience in use of a reputable Procurement Management Software or ERP system.
	Experience of solving complex issues through analysis, definition of a clear way forward and ensuring buy-in.
	Great interpersonal and communication skills including negotiation and relationship building.
	High level of integrity/confidentiality and ability to work as part of a professional team.
	Highly developed cultural awareness and ability to work well in an international environment with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.
	High level of computer literacy. Especially excellent MS Excel/Word skills.
	Good oral and written communication skills; Fluency in spoken and written English.
	Commitment to LABDI’s values


Skills and Behaviours (our Values in Practice):
Accountability:


	Accuracy and timeliness in all areas of responsibility.
	High level of accuracy in work, and ability to analyse complex sets of relationships and situations.
	Holds self and others accountable


Ambition:


	Creating best-in-class function.
	Future-orientated, thinks pro-actively


Collaboration:


	Working effectively with stakeholders to achieve common goals.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Builds and maintains effective relationships, with their team, colleagues, members and external partners approachable, good listener, easy to talk to


Creativity:


	Designing more effective admin systems.
	Willing to take disciplined risks


Integrity:


	Honest, encourages openness and transparency, demonstrates highest levels of integrity.


Note


	Qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply.
	LABDI has zero tolerance to sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA), any act of child abuse including sexual exploitation and sexual abuse constitute acts of serious misconduct and are therefore grounds for LABDI plenary measures, including summary dismissal.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "DevOps Engineer",
  "description": "Daystar Power Group is a Pan-African provider of solar and hybrid power solutions, offering its systems on a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA), fixed monthly fee lease, or buy-out basis. All our solutions are accompanied by comprehensive maintenance services, to ensure the solutions run 365 days a year. We are currently operational in seven countries including Nigeria, Ghana, Togo, Senegal, and Ivory Coast, and have recently launched in South Africa and Tanzania.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;DevOps Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full time

Job Summary


	We are looking to engage a competent and experienced DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for Applications Management, Software Development, exploring Technologies such as AI &amp; Hyper-automation and server as the IT Business Management process lead.
	In addition, He or She would also mentor citizen developers in Low/No-code tools development.
	The job scope covers service management activities, Cloud operational landscapes with many integration points; and the integration of the interdependent services of diverse internal and external service providers into end-to-end services which deliver value to Daystar from the Lagos - Nigeria office.
	We are seeking a hard-working, self-motivated, and well-organized individual with a focus on continuous improvement to exceed expectations.


Key Responsibilities


	Translate functional requirements into technical specifications with input from subject matter experts and Design Authority.
	Understanding business requirements to pilot and prototype new solutions and technologies, including procurement, setup, development, demonstration, and deployment.
	Manage complex integration scenarios and interfaces between cloud and legacy systems.
	Design, development, testing and implementation of software solutions designed for web applications.
	Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
	Identify/correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
	Utilize AWS and Power BI for data acquisition, transformation, and visualization. Automate key business processes using Power Apps and tools like Python.
	Responsible for maintaining code quality, organization, and automation.
	Work closely with the product and UX Team to develop user experience optimization.
	Contribute to functional excellence in terms of definition and maintenance of standards, methods and tools, bringing in best practices from market standard implementations.
	Support Projects and Support teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirement gathering, analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation, and production support for software systems.
	Coach business users on low/no-code tools to automate their own processes.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s/ Master&rsquo;s degree in ICT, Electrical/Electronic Engineering and Computer Science. Candidates with degrees in other subjects but with strong hands-on domain achievements and relevant certifications in the areas listed above are also acceptable.
	Minimum Five (5) years of relevant experience in Application Delivery &amp; Support, DevOps and Integration technologies.
	Proficient in using Power Apps and Power BI.
	Demonstrable experience/skill in React.js, Next.js, GitHub and Python.
	Proven subject matter expertise working with cloud technologies like Azure/AWS Platform, MongoDB.
	Experience in supporting a diverse application landscape, including change management, application testing, data integrity management, patch management and end-user support and training.
	ITIL Certification (preferred).
	Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools such as Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and the use to run scrum meetings.


Benefits


	Opportunity to work in a forward-looking, innovative company, with international group of colleagues.
	Unlimited career opportunities - depending on achievements and personal development.
	A competitive salary and benefits package with long term prospect in a fast-growing company.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Daystar Power Group"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185289"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



DevOps Engineer Job at Daystar Power Group




        
    

        
        Daystar Power Group is a Pan-African provider of solar and hybrid power solutions, offering its systems on a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA), fixed monthly fee lease, or buy-out basis. All our solutions are accompanied by comprehensive maintenance services, to ensure the solutions run 365 days a year. We are currently operational in seven countries including Nigeria, Ghana, Togo, Senegal, and Ivory Coast, and have recently launched in South Africa and Tanzania.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking to engage a competent and experienced DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for Applications Management, Software Development, exploring Technologies such as AI & Hyper-automation and server as the IT Business Management process lead.
	In addition, He or She would also mentor citizen developers in Low/No-code tools development.
	The job scope covers service management activities, Cloud operational landscapes with many integration points; and the integration of the interdependent services of diverse internal and external service providers into end-to-end services which deliver value to Daystar from the Lagos - Nigeria office.
	We are seeking a hard-working, self-motivated, and well-organized individual with a focus on continuous improvement to exceed expectations.


Key Responsibilities


	Translate functional requirements into technical specifications with input from subject matter experts and Design Authority.
	Understanding business requirements to pilot and prototype new solutions and technologies, including procurement, setup, development, demonstration, and deployment.
	Manage complex integration scenarios and interfaces between cloud and legacy systems.
	Design, development, testing and implementation of software solutions designed for web applications.
	Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
	Identify/correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
	Utilize AWS and Power BI for data acquisition, transformation, and visualization. Automate key business processes using Power Apps and tools like Python.
	Responsible for maintaining code quality, organization, and automation.
	Work closely with the product and UX Team to develop user experience optimization.
	Contribute to functional excellence in terms of definition and maintenance of standards, methods and tools, bringing in best practices from market standard implementations.
	Support Projects and Support teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirement gathering, analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation, and production support for software systems.
	Coach business users on low/no-code tools to automate their own processes.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s/ Master’s degree in ICT, Electrical/Electronic Engineering and Computer Science. Candidates with degrees in other subjects but with strong hands-on domain achievements and relevant certifications in the areas listed above are also acceptable.
	Minimum Five (5) years of relevant experience in Application Delivery & Support, DevOps and Integration technologies.
	Proficient in using Power Apps and Power BI.
	Demonstrable experience/skill in React.js, Next.js, GitHub and Python.
	Proven subject matter expertise working with cloud technologies like Azure/AWS Platform, MongoDB.
	Experience in supporting a diverse application landscape, including change management, application testing, data integrity management, patch management and end-user support and training.
	ITIL Certification (preferred).
	Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools such as Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and the use to run scrum meetings.


Benefits


	Opportunity to work in a forward-looking, innovative company, with international group of colleagues.
	Unlimited career opportunities - depending on achievements and personal development.
	A competitive salary and benefits package with long term prospect in a fast-growing company.
